comment.author: 46650209@N07
comment._content:
There are at least 2 tie wearers among the workmen.
The boss has a fine leather coat, that plank was no doubt put down for him, but the rolled up trousers indicate that he was taking no chances!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/patrick_castelli] I know! Was wondering how much a leather coat would have cost back then...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Fairly uncommon in Ireland but the gentleman in question is probably Herr something or other from Germany as this was their great project and leather coats were more common there!

comment.author: 41675580@N08
46650209@N07
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/alimarante] It could be a food inspection, Herr Ingenieur is making sure the workers' victuals are suited to the task!
And the foreman is making sure everybody is appreciating the food!

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/alimarante] Crikey, don't think there's anything wrong with your imagination at all!  :D
